skill.name: creating-skills
skill.description:
Guides creation of effective Agent Skills with proper structure and validation.
Use when users want to create a new skill, update an existing skill, or need
guidance on skill design patterns, SKILL.md format, or verify.py implementation.
NOT when just using existing skills (use those skills directly).

security_audit.summary: Documentation-focused skill for skill development. Contains no network operations, no credential access, and no arbitrary code execution. Static findings are all false positives: YAML frontmatter was flagged as weak crypto, markdown code blocks as shell backticks, and the word 'EVALUATE' as dynamic eval(). All file operations are controlled and user-specified.

content.value_statement: Users struggle to build modular, reusable Agent Skills that follow best practices. This skill provides a complete framework for skill creation including templates, validation scripts, and design pattern guidance.
actual_capabilities: Scaffold new skills from template using init_skill.py
Write effective SKILL.md frontmatter and descriptions
limitations: Does not execute user code or interact with external APIs
Skills must be developed manually following provided guidance
No automatic skill deployment or installation

use_cases.title: Build New Skills
use_cases.description: Create modular skills with proper structure, templates, and validation from scratch.

use_cases.title: Standardize Skill Patterns
use_cases.description: Establish consistent skill design patterns across a team or organization.

use_cases.title: Package Skills
use_cases.description: Validate and package skills into distributable .skill files for deployment.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill for handling SQL queries. Walk me through the skill creation process using the creating-skills skill.

prompt_templates.title: Design Skill Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to design a skill for document processing. What structure and resources should it include? Use creating-skills for guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my skill at the current directory using the verify.py script. What needs to be fixed?

prompt_templates.title: Package for Distribution
prompt_templates.prompt: Package my skill into a .skill file for distribution. Run package_skill.py on the skill folder.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for reviewing SQL queries
output: Recommended resources: scripts/ for query validation, references/ for SQL patterns
Frontmatter: description focuses on trigger conditions
Next step: Run init_skill.py to scaffold the skill
Checking name format: Valid gerund form

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 5000 tokens and use references/ for detailed documentation
Write descriptions as triggering conditions, not workflow summaries
Include verify.py in every skill for automated validation
Use scripts/ for deterministic operations that benefit from execution without context loading
anti_patterns: Including README.md, INSTALLATION_GUIDE.md, or CHANGELOG.md in skills
Summarizing workflow in description instead of listing triggering conditions
Putting all documentation in SKILL.md instead of using references/

faq.question: What tools support .skill files?
faq.answer: Claude, Claude Code, and Codex can load and use packaged .skill files following the skill specification.

faq.question: What is the maximum size for SKILL.md?
faq.answer: SKILL.md body should stay under 5000 tokens. For larger content, use references/ directory files.

faq.question: How do skills integrate with MCP?
faq.answer: Skills work alongside MCP tools. Skills provide procedural knowledge while MCP tools provide specific capabilities.

faq.question: Is data from skills stored anywhere?
faq.answer: Skills are loaded into context during sessions. No persistent storage or data collection occurs.

faq.question: Why does verification fail?
faq.answer: Common causes: missing YAML frontmatter, no 'Use when' in description, invalid name format, or missing verify.py script.

faq.question: How is this different from system prompts?
faq.answer: Skills are modular and activated on-demand. System prompts are always present. Skills provide specialized knowledge for specific domains.
